Casting Memories

This is a provocative, personal project that confronts the impact and legacy of looted art and white supremacy in museums.

It centers the perspective and intimate experience of a Nigerian artist / technologist / scammer learning about their stolen history and identity through the Benin Bronzes in the Smithsonian collections.

Gallery

Short intro blurb about what we made + credits to the team. A necessary part of recontextualizing this work and trauma was finding creative ways to reconnect with this work outside of a museum context.

We remade and remixed to open up the possibilities, so that people donâ€™t have to engage with this content inside museum collections.
